"Knowing the circumstances of the economy and the company concerned, the Nath government’s aim is to recover the dues, which is why four years’ time has been given," Oza argued, adding: “We are not the BJP, whose modus operandi is known in case of Nirav Modi , Mehul Chouksey and Vijay Mallya .”

BJP criticized the Congress government for “giving exemptions to select industries” when the state is battling financial crisis. “The Congress government has decided to exempt recovery of Rs 450 dues from industrialist Anil Ambani in four years. This proves that it’s a government of industrialists and capitalists. The chief minister himself is an industrialist. He is worried more about increasing capital of industrialists,” alleged leader of opposition Gopal Bhargava .

BJP chief whip in assembly Narottam Mishra joined the attack, saying, “The government is running an industrial policy at the cost of public money for the convenience of industrialists.”

Rejecting BJP’s allegations, public relations minister P C Sharma said that the government is investor- and industry-friendly and aims to promote industries to create more jobs. “The vision and intention of Congress government and chief minister is very much clear. The government is promoting investors and industries. This is a part of investor friendly policy of the government,” said Sharma.

State Congress spokesman Narendra Saluja explained that the decision has been taken under rules of the 2014 Investment Promotion Policy of the erstwhile BJP government. “Under this policy, the company has been asked to repay dues within the next four years. The policy clearly states that firms investing Rs 500 crore and more can get up to 12 years to pay their dues,” he pointed out.

Oza hit out at BJP, holding it responsible for the slowdown of economy. “People like Nirav Modi and Vijay Mallya fled with Rs 2.70 lakh crore and NPAs have grown to 126%,” she pointed, adding: “The nation’s debts have increased by 71% in the last six years. Over 5 lakh crore worth of loans of top industrialists have been written off by the NDA government. The MP government has not written off dues, like the Centre. This government is only giving more time to the company to pay its dues.”

Title: Set up waste mgmt unit or pay Rs 25k to Rs 50k penalty
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Mangaluru: Mangaluru City Corporation (MCC) has warned that all bulk waste generators must have their own waste management units or else cough up a hefty penalty .

A penalty to the tune of Rs 25,000 will be imposed on bulk waste generators including apartments, small industries, hostels, educational institutions, marriage halls and restaurants from Monday, if they do not set up waste management units in their premises, said MCC commissioner S Ajith Kumar Hegde .

“If they fail to comply with the waste management rules, a penalty to the tune of Rs 50,000 will be levied on them in the second round of the drive. MCC has already sent notices to 1,948 owners for not adhering to the rules. More than 2,000 apartments, 1,670 restaurants and hotels as well as other bulk waste generators in the city have been given a deadline of February 10 to set up waste management units as per Solid Waste Management Rules 2016,” Hegde said.

The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has expressed its concern over urban local bodies failing to manage solid waste effectively. The NGT has issued guidelines and directed the government to submit a compliance report once in three months. Hence, the state government is very serious about the implementation of Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.

Accordingly, the MCC has conducted workshops twice for all bulk waste generators including apartments, hostels, educational institutions, hotels, restaurants, marriage halls, catering services, merchants, chicken stalls, small industries, builders and others.

Initially, they were given October 31, 2019 as the deadline to comply with the waste management rules. However, most of them have not installed waste management units in their premises, he said.

Title: Fire in grid, 1.5 lakh consumers left in dark for over 10 hours
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Photo for representative purpose only

INDORE: Power supply to over 1.5 lakh consumers of rural and city’s north division was affected for more than 10 hours, when two power transformers of power transmission company of 220 KV Jaitpura Grid, burst on Friday morning.

This included around one lakh consumers of city’s north division and some 50,000 consumers of Dharmpuri and Sanwer. Operations of around 100 industrial units of Bardari were also affected following the incident that took place at around 8.15am.

Two power transformers including 160MVA and 40MVA were completely destroyed in a massive fire, which broke out from a current transformer installed near these transformers.

The sound of explosion was so loud that it created panic among locals of nearby villages including Dharampuri and Jaitpura. Thick smoke could be seen from about half a kilometre.

“We heard two explosions one after another in a gap of 10 minutes and the grid had caught fire, when we reached the area. Power supply of our village went off immediately after the explosion,” said Ajay Chouhan, a villager from Dharampuri.

Supply from the grid was snapped immediately after the incident came to the notice of power transmission company employees, who later raised an alarm and called fire brigade.

It took about five hours for fire tenders to bring the situation under control as oil kept leaking from power transformers. Dharampuri, Dhaturia, Aswaya, Hatunia, Tarana, Barlai and nearby areas were the worst affected. In city’s north circle, supply to Sanwer Road, Aurbindo Hospital, Jaitpura industrial belt and Sukhlia areas had major impact.

Madhya Pradesh Paschim Kshetra Vidyut Vitaran Company Limited (MPPKVVCL) managing director Vikas Narwal claimed that the situation was brought under control within five hours after the incident and supply to 90 per cent of the affected feeders was restored before sunset.

“We had our team of some 10 engineers and 50, who were engaged to ensure alternate arrangements to restore supply. Supply to most of the affected areas was restored till 6.00pm,” Narwal told TOI. “We aim to restore supply from the affected grid by Saturday evening. Till then supply to connected areas could be affected for short intervals,” he added. The incident has also prompted state energy minister Priyavrat Singh to order an inquiry into the incident. “An inquiry will be conducted to ascertain the exact reason behind the fault,” the minister stated in an official note.

Title: Basti district to be renamed after sage Vashishtha
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Gorakhpur: The renaming of Basti district after Maharishi Vashishth appears to be on the cards with the local administration sending a proposal on this to the state's revenue board.

The cost of implementing the change is estimated to be around Rs 1 crore and the district administration is learnt to have sent an expenditure report to the state headquarters for a final nod.

In the past, the Yogi government rechristened Mughalsarai railway junction after RSS ideologue Deen Dayal Upadhyay and renamed the districts of Allahabad and Faizabad as Prayagraj and Ayodhya, respectively.

A year ago, during Basti Mahotsav, the chief minister had announced that Basti Medical College would be named after Maharshi Vashishtha, one of the most revered Vedic sages. Thereafter, many citizens — including MP Harish Dwivedi and MLA Ajay Kumar Singh — began demanding that the district be renamed as well. On November 28 last year, a proposal to change the name of Basti district was sent to the Revenue Board. After analysis of expenditure, district magistrate Ashutosh Niranjan sent the report to zonal commissioner Anil Kumar Sagar who in turn forwarded a revised version to the government.

“We estimate an expenditure of Rs 1 crore. A final approval is awaited before Basti is renamed,” DM Niranjan said.

Title: Chennai: Island Grounds to have round-the-year tourist activities
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation has decided to hold exhibitions and amusement rides throughout the ... Read More

CHENNAI: Waking up to the locational advantage of the Island Grounds in Chennai, the Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation (TTDC) has decided to hold exhibitions and amusement rides throughout the year. This will be in addition to the annual trade fair.

The development comes in the backdrop of a go-kart operator withdrawing the services from Island Grounds. “While the contract for offering the go-kart service was valid for three years, the private operator wound up the services midway. So we have called for tenders to utilise the space for establishing other tourist activities,” a senior tourism department official said.

As per the tender floated by TTDC, an area measuring 45,000sqft will be provided to the successful bidder to organise exhibition and amusement rides. “The space can be utilised for organising different activities, including laser shows. However, the concept should be formulated by the bidder on revenue-sharing model with TTDC,” the official added.

The massive 29-acre land parcel remains idle for the entire year, except during the 70-day annual India Tourist and Industrial Fair held between December and February every year. During Deepavali season, cracker shops are set up. Attempts had been made in the past to convert the Island Grounds into a happening place by organising food fair and banana festival a decade ago. It, however, did not continue after change in regime.

Tamil Nadu Tour Travel and Hospitality Association president V K T Balan said food-on-wheels providing international cuisines could be made part of Island Grounds. "There should be no permanent structure installed on the premises. 45 trucks offering a range of food and cultural dance performances from across the country in an area of 45,000 square feet will be a major crowd-puller," he said. Tourists and visitors could be kept engaged from dusk to dawn, he added.

Title: Ahmedabad: Arrest warrant issued against Hardik Patel again
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Hardik Patel

AHMEDABAD: A city sessions court once again issued an arrest warrant against Hardik Patel , a Congress activist and former convenor of the Patidar Anamat Andolan Samiti (PAAS), for skipping court proceeding in a sedition case on Friday.

The court issued a non-bailable warrant for the second time in 20 days, with the observation that it had granted bail on arrest when such an arrest warrant had been issued on January 18, on condition that Patel not skip court proceedings. As he continued to remain absent, he cannot get any legal protection, the court said while issuing the warrant against him and rejecting his application seeking exemption from appearing in court, on Friday.

Before the warrant was issued, Patel’s advocate tendered applied for exemption from presence in court, saying Patel fears being arrested in the 2015 case concerning the violence that took place at the GMDC ground. Police intend to harass him and if he comes to attend court proceedings.

Title: 57 people kept under watch after they return from China
Content: Hyderabad: Fifty-seven persons, who have come back from China, are under the direct watch of the health department for a possible coronavirus alert. Officials are monitoring them regularly in their homes. These 57 people are those who have not been tested for the virus but are under observation.Officials said these people would be kept under observation for 28 days and away from family members. The health department tracked their details thanks to help from RGIA officials and Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP) authorities. Some people approached the health authorities directly through a call centre.Seventeen persons were referred to the health department on Friday and 16 of them were kept under observation. “Such people are referred to as asymptomatic (people showing no symptoms but still kept under watch) patients,” an official said.Officials said of the 57 people, 90% are in Hyderabad. The district epidemic cells are also keeping an eye on them. “They are advised to stay at home and not go out,” an official said. Meanwhile, five new suspect cases of coronavirus were reported at Gandhi Hospital. However, there were no new cases in the chest hospital. Health minister Eatala Rajender allayed fears on the virus and said there was no reason for panic in the state.

Title: Woman electrocuted, 3 kids suffocated to death
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Allahabad: Autopsy reports of the 35-year-old widow and her three children, who were found dead at their Aswa Daudpur village home in trans-Ganga on Thursday morning, have indicated that the woman was electrocuted and the minor girls were smothered to death.

Preliminary investigation into the deaths of Manju Devi, a bidi worker, and her daughters Priya (8), Annu (6) and Ritika (4) had suggested suicide, as the main door was locked from the inside.

However, the postmortem examinations are now questioning that theory of police and vindicating the bereaved family’s suspicions that the woman and her children were either murdered or the woman was forced to take the extreme step.

SSP Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj confirmed the autopsy reports on Friday and said a detailed probe had been ordered. “The mother was electrocuted and the minors suffocated to death, possibly on being smothered with a pillow. Forensic experts are looking for clues to nail culprits, if any,” he said.

Manju Devi’s parents have accused her two brothers-in-law, Mahesh and Dinesh, of harassing her since her husband Ramesh Bharatiya passed away four years ago. Mahesh and Manju’s father-in-law Shri Nath were detained for questioning on Thursday. The SSP said the role of the in-laws would be thoroughly investigated.

Title: Bhopal: Passerby jumps into dam to foil woman’s suicide bid
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

24-year-old Anil Maithil jumped in Bhadbhada dam to save a 20-year-old woman

BHOPAL: A 20-year-old woman, who jumped into the Bhadbhada dam on Friday morning to commit suicide was saved by a vigilant marketing executive, who happened to pass the bridge at that time.

The youth saw the woman and jumped in to rescue her. Kamla Nagar police reached the spot on getting information and handed over the woman to her family members, after counselling her. SHO Kamla Nagar, SI Vijay Sisodia said that Anil Maithil , 24, who rescued the woman, stays in Gora Gaon and works for a private company. His marriage is scheduled to take place two days later on February 9, but still he had the courage to jump off the bridge to rescue a woman in distress.

Maithil told TOI that on Friday morning he had gone to meet his friends in Nehru Nagar area on a bike. On his way back, when he reached the Bhadbhada Bridge, he saw someone jump into the dam. “I stopped my bike immediately and spotted a woman in the water. Without wasting any time, I jumped in the dam and grabbed the woman’s hand. Within minutes, locals arranged for a rope and threw it down so that we could hold it and come out safely,” said Maithil.

The youngster said that he had grown up in village and knew swimming, so he jumped off without any hesitation to rescue the woman. SHO Sisodia said that rescued woman told the cops that she is a student and stays with her family in Kamla Nagar. Her father had dropped her at the college on Friday morning, but instead of attending the classes, she went to Bhadbhada Bridge to commit suicide.

She said that she was suffering from depression for the past few days but did not reveal the reason behind her extreme step.

Title: State budget would have provisions to improve ease of doing business: CM Gehlot
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Times News Network

Jaipur: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said the state budget would have provisions to improve ease of doing business , which according to him was the only way to improve finances in the wake of the economic slump.

Addressing a state-level tax advisory committee meeting, he said revenue collection in Goods and Services Tax (GST) remained below expectations due to which the states did not get much funds from the Centre.

“Also, the Centre has reduced subsidy for various schemes which is affecting development work. In such a scenario, industrial development can only bring prosperity in the state,” Gehlot said.

“The state government is taking several steps to promote industries and more efforts will be made for fair provisions in the state budget to make the economic atmosphere better,” he said.

Gehlot said several important policies, new laws and schemes had been implemented to promote industries and a better atmosphere had been created for them to grow and develop. In the budget too, industries would be well taken care of,” he said.

At the meeting, representatives of different industrial organisations gave their suggestions on the budget. Additional chief secretary (finance) Niranjan Arya said fair and constructive policies would be incorporated in the budget.

Energy minister B D Kalla and industry minister Parsadi Lal Meena were among those who attended the meeting.

Title: AIIMS Rishikesh to prepare database of cancer patients in Uttarakhand
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

AIIMS Rishikesh

DEHRADUN: All India Institute of Medical Sciences ( AIIMS ) Rishikesh will conduct Uttarakhand ’s first population-based cancer registry in the cities situated along the banks of Ganga in the state. According to authorities, the study aims to determine the river’s effect on the people residing in its vicinity.

Cancer surgeon of AIIMS Rishikesh Dr Pankaj Garg told TOI that the project will cover cities of Haridwar and Rishikesh, which are close to the Ganga.

AIIMS got a sanction for the registry from Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), which is the approving authority on the project. At present, there are 32 population-based cancer registries in India.

“Our project is part of ICMR’s initiative of finding out the number of cancer patients and types of cancer affecting residents of cities alongside Ganga. We have started advertising about recruitments of staff,” said Garg, adding that the registry process will start in April 2020.

AIIMS officials will go door to door to collect the data in Rishikesh. In Haridwar, the data will be collected from hospitals and other sources.

Title: Hyderabad: GST Intelligence arrests CA for Rs 69 crore fake invoice fraud
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Director General of GST Intelligence , Hyderabad unit has arrested a chartered accountant, PVV Satyanarayana who had floated several fake invoices worth Rs 69 crore.

The accused Satyanarayana has been remanded to judicial custody at Chanchalaguda jail.

“GST invoices were routed and circulated through a complex web of companies without the backing of the corresponding supply of goods and services. The chartered accountant is the key operator behind the firms in organising paper invoices for contract services and obtaining LED electrical equipment, two widely diverging business,” said GST officials.

In one of the firms, PVV Satyanarayana issued fake invoices worth Rs 69 crore and attempted to pass irregular and an illegal input tax credit of Rs 12.4 crore. The fake invoices given by him were utilised by the several companies to offset their GST liability that they would have otherwise discharged in cash.

“The chartered accountant has indulged in several transactions involving circular trading to officially boost the turnover. Some of the leading infrastructure companies are beneficiaries of the illicit ITC passed out,” said GST officials.

DGGI provisionally attached three bank accounts of Satyanarayana’s firm. He had done transactions in Andhra Pradesh, Maharasthra, Odisha and Madhya Pradesh.

DGGI have carried out simultaneous searches on 12 premises from January 22 to February 5 in and around Hyderabad. They busted a module involved in issuing invoices without supplying any goods or services.

DGGI seized several incriminating documents including copies of fake invoices issued on letterheads of various firms which existed merely on paper.

Title: Chemical tanker overturns near Dumad crossroads
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

The fire brigade operation continued for 2 hours causing a jam

VADODARA: Heavy traffic jam was witnessed near Dumad Crossroads on outskirts of Vadodara city when a truck carrying chemicals overturned early Friday morning. A chemical identified as isobutyl benzene began leaking out of the truck spreading panic among locals as well as passersby. Fire brigade officials rushed to the spot after they got a call at 5.30 am.

“We were earlier told that the liquid was chloroform. But it turned out to be isobutyl benzene. It is highly inflammable liquid that also causes respiratory problems. We stopped the seepage and then began spraying water on the chemical,” said Om Jadeja, fire officer. Out of 25,000 litres, nearly 7,000 litres chemical leaked from the tanker. However, there were no reports of any person getting affected by the leakage.

The fire brigade operation continued for nearly two hours causing heavy traffic jam on the busy highway that connects the city with Vadodara-Ahmedabad expressway. To tackle the traffic jam, the police diverted traffic coming from Dumad towards city. By afternoon, traffic became normal on the highway. Driver of the truck has been missing since the incident. The police said that the truck was coming from Gandhidham and was on its way to Halol taluka in Panchmahal .

Title: Desert festival opens amidst fanfare in Jaisalmer
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Jaisalmer: The desert festival was formally inaugurated at Jaisalmer with a procession on Friday. Folk cultural programmes and several competitions were also organised on the occasion.

A large number of domestic and foreign tourists thronged the desert district to enjoy the festival. Many foreigners were seen dressed in the traditional Rajasthani attire with dhoti, kurta and safa. Omprakash Vaishnav won the title of ‘Mr Desert’ and Mansi Chandak won the title of ‘Miss Desert.’ The grand procession was taken out from the Sonar fort which was flagged off by district collector Namit Mehta and MLA Rooparam by releasing balloons in the air. Public representatives, district administration and police officials, artistes, school children, residents as well as tourists were present during the event.

Various artistes danced and played folk music in the procession. Decorated camel riders and band players were the centres of attraction. The procession was led by women carrying ‘mangal kalash’ on their heads with folk artistes playing music and people clad in traditional attire celebrating. Tourists could be seen clicking photographs and capturing the colours of the programme. The residents of the city welcomed the procession by showering it with flowers.

The procession was welcomed by a large number of people when it reached Shaheed Poonam Singh Stadium. Several programmes were organised at the stadium. As many as 39 contestants took part in ‘Mr Desert’ and Vaishnav won the competition, while out of 12 participants, Chandak won the title of ‘Miss Desert.’ As many as 15 people took part in the turban-tying competition, in which Sawai Singh Tanwar stood first, followed by Azad Khan and Nikhil Changani as second and third respectively. Among foreigners, Martha (Spain), Gil (Canada) and Lawrence (England) won the first three positions in the turban-tying competition.

BSF’s Kanu Charan, Kishore Kumar Kalla and Mahendra Singh Shekhawat won the first three prizes respectively in the moustache competition. Similarly, a competition was organised for foreigners related to Rajasthani dress, wherein Roland stood first, Dominique stood second and Alan won the third prize in the male category; while among women, Asia (Poland), Mesu (Japan) and Kate (England) won the first three prizes respectively.

Title: UGDs: MLA warns of criminal case against contractors
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Mangaluru: Mangaluru City North MLA Dr Y Bharath Shetty warned contractors who are taking up underground drainage (UGD) works in the city, not to let sewage flow into stormwater drains.

He said that he has received complaints from the public that contractors have been diverting sewage from UGD pipelines into open drains. He warned that criminal cases will be booked against contractors if they continue to divert sewage into open drains.

Chairing a meeting of people’s representatives and officials of Karnataka Urban Infrastructure Development and Finance Corporation (KUIDFC), the MLA said water resources at many places in the city have been polluted due to the flow of sewage from the UGD.

“I have received many complaints that contractors have been putting the UGD flow into open drains when they take up development works. This is an unscientific method, which will contaminate the water resources in the nearby areas. Hence, they should take up work scientifically. We will have to file criminal cases against them if they do not take up work scientifically,” the MLA warned.

Under the Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (Amrut) scheme, Rs 60 crore has been reserved for the repair of UGDs. There is a need to check the quality of work, he said. “I have already directed officials to take up initiatives to purify wells and other water resources, which are polluted due to unscientific UGD work,” he added.

Title: Doon station to open for passengers after three months
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Dehradun: After being closed for train movements on November 10 last year for renovation work, the railway station will be reopened for passengers from Saturday. Moradabad railway division’s officials made a visit to the station on Friday for inspection after which they said that the renovation has been completed in time.

“The renovation was crucial as length of most of the platforms were so short that an 18-coach train couldn’t take a halt there. Also, the infrastructure had become outdated,” said NN Singh, additional divisional railway manager (ADRM), Moradabad.

He added that after the yard revamp, 18-coach trains will be able to come to the station. “We will add three coaches to most of the trains to increase the carrying capacity,” said Singh.

Seven trains will reach and depart from Dehradun from Saturday, informed the official. These trains will be —12017/18-Shatabdi Express, 14041/42 Mussoorie Express, 12401/12402 Nandadevi AC Express, 14119/14120 Kathgodam Express, 14631/32 Amritsar Express, 13009/13010 Doon Express, and 15002 Muzaffarpur Express.

Other trains will be regularised gradually, he added.

Title: Ahmedabad: Wife hits man, tries to strangle his mother
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A Sola-based advocate on Friday filed a complaint with the city police alleging that his wife, who is a chartered accountant, had beaten him and tried to strangle his mother after he alleged that she had an affair with her business partner.

In his FIR with Sola high court police, the advocate, 38, stated that the incident took place at his home in Sola area during wee hours on Thursday.

He states in the FIR that he had married the chartered accountant, 35, who hails from Pune, in 2007. After their marriage, the couple settled in Ahmedabad where he started practising law and the woman began working with a chartered accountant firm.

For the past six months, he and his wife had been working at his office near Kargil Crossroads on SG Road.

“My wife has been working with her business partner for four months. Her business partner, who has his office in the Bodakdev area, used to visit my office to meet my wife very frequently,” states the FIR.

“I heard my staff members gossiping about my wife’s illicit relationship with her business partner. I also had doubts over their relationship so I installed CCTV cameras in my office,” the advocate stated in the FIR.

He states that he had worked at his office till late on Thursday night and reached home at around 3am on Friday.

“When I reached home, my wife and my mother were awake. As soon as I entered the house, my wife began asking the reason behind installing CCTV cameras at office. I told her my staff had told me what she does at the office with her business partner. For this, I had installed the CCTV cameras,” he states.

To this, his wife became angry over him and allegedly began abusing him. She also threatened him that she and her business partner would kill him.

“My wife then got very angry, and my mother tried to pacify her. But she pushed my mother and tried to choke her. When I tried to rescue my mother, she beat me and threatened to kill me,” he states in the FIR.

The man then approached Sola high court police and filed a complaint of causing hurt, uttering abuses and criminal intimidation against his wife.

Title: Muzaffarnagar cops to lend a hand keeping locals fit
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: The Muzaffarnagar police has decided to join the “Fit India Movement” by encouraging people to remain healthy and fit by including physical activities and sports in their daily lives. In this context, police has sought suggestions from public regarding measures to ensure city residents take to regular fitness regime.

According to police sources, the task will be undertaken at every thana level wherein areas such as school and college grounds, parks and police line fields will be identified for carrying out daily exercises. Yoga teachers, gym instructors and ordinary citizens are being asked to give ideas and contribute in holding and supervising daily exercises.

Last year, police in Muzaffarnagar had launched an anti-drugs drive in which hundreds of youth and social activists had joined. It helped police to bust drug peddling and arrest the sellers.

When asked, senior superintendent of police, Muzaffarnagar, Abhishek Yadav said, “We are working on a plan to make ordinary people, especially the youth and working people who do not have the means to keep themselves fit by providing them a place where they go for exercising and following a fitness regime. We received many ideas and offers to help people in keeping fit by yoga teachers, gym instructors and health-conscious people.”

Asked where the fitness programmes will be conducted, the SSP said, “It is not possible to bring thousands of people at one place and so, we will use the police-line field in the city and school or college's grounds in rural areas for the purpose.”

Locals said this concept will not aid people to take part in sports events but also those living in rural areas will get easy access to police.

A rural-based health-conscious man, Rajender Kumar , said, “I have been exercising at home without any guidance I will join the fitness programme if they are going to organized in my area. It will also be beneficial for people who often face difficulties in approaching police.”

Title: Uttarakhand: College manager held in SC/ST scholarship scam
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Representative image

HARIDWAR: The manager of the committee responsible for running Swami Purnanand Degree College of Technical Education was arrested on Friday in connection with the multi-crore SC/ST scholarship scam .

In October, a case was registered against accused Sanjay Kumar Agarwal under sections 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 409 (criminal breach of trust by public servant, or by banker, merchant or agent), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating), and 471 (using a forged document or electronic record as genuine) of the Indian Penal Code . However, Agarwal, a resident of Meena enclave under Jwalapur police station jurisdiction in Haridwar , was absconding since then.

Investigation officer Sanjeet Kumar told TOI, “During investigation, it was revealed that Sanjay Kumar Agarwalwas responsible for withdrawing amount from the account and he used the scholarship fundsfor fraudulent purposes.”

Title: Gujarat: Tribals block roads to demand ST reservation
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Tribals stage protest on the highway

VADODARA: Traffic movement in the tribal-dominated Chhota Udepur district was affected severely on Friday after the locals observed a bandh to protest government’s inaction in including Koli Rathwas in the schedule tribe (ST) category. The tribal leaders alleged that the government hasn’t fulfilled its promise and if it still fails to meet their demands, the protests will only grow stronger.

On Friday morning, shops and business establishments across the district including Chhota Udepur town remained closed. Post offices, banks and even milk dairies downed their shutters as the protesters took over state highways as well as national highway from Vadodara to Chhota Udepur.

The protesters blocked highways by felling trees and burning tyres. However, no violence was reported from any part of the district.

Talking to TOI, Sangram Rathwa, son of former Congress MP from Chhota Udepur Naran Rathwa, claimed that the entire tribal community including leaders from all parties supported the bandh which was very “successful”.

“We have been demanding inclusion of Koli Rathwas in ST category for a long time. Our men, who were hired as lok rakshak dal (LRD) personnel last year, were also harassed by the government department that kept asking them for various certificates,” Rathwa further alleged.

“The government has included several non-tribal communities in ST but Koli Rathwas are still facing injustice. We have met the chief minister three times with regard to the issue. If the government doesn’t accept our demands, we will be forced to intensify our stir,” he said.

The government departments mention Koli Rathwas as Koli which comes under other backward classes (OBC). Hence, Koli Rathwa community people get notices asking them to produce various certificates after they get government jobs in ST quota. “This is sheer harassment of our community’s youth,” he added.

Congress MLA from Chhota Udepur, Mohan Rathwa said, “Ration cards, Aadhaar cards and even names in their bank accounts have Rathwa surname. But the government doesn’t consider them from Rathwa community. Even in LRD exams, 24 students of this community scored above 73 per cent but didn’t get jobs.”

Chhota Udepur SP, M S Bhabhor said, “The protesters had blocked the highways for some time but we cleared the roads soon. Protesters stood in front of a train in Bodeli but made no attempt to delay the train.”

Title: Conman poses as girl using voice modulation app, dupes man of Rs 62K
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Kanpur: A man was duped of Rs 62,000 by a miscreant from a neighbouring village, who used to talk to him on phone as a girl by using a voice modulation application.

The victim, who works as driver of the village head, nabbed the accused, a resident of Bidhnoo area, and handed him over to police but was let off after he promised to return the money. The two sides amicably resolved the issue, said police.

The driver of a village head had recently filed a complaint stating that a man had cheated him using voice modulation. “The accused, pretended to be a girl and took Rs 62,000 from the driver over various pretexts, ” said inspector Devendra Solanki.

“During investigation, it was found that the caller was a man pretending to be a girl. The accused was detained when he came to the driver’s house to collect money on Wednesday. The accused revealed that he was unemployed and thus came up with a plan to call bachelors of adjoining villages. He used to chat with them in female voice with the help of a voice modulation application and duped them of money. He called the driver posing as a girl, saying he was handsome, their horoscopes matched and she wanted to marry him,” the inspector said.

About a month passed but whenever the driver asked for a meeting in person, he was given some or the other excuse. The accused then asked the driver to send some money saying ‘her’ family was in some financial problem.

The driver gave Rs 62,000 but soon realised that he had been cheated, and approached police.

“The driver caught the accused on Wednesday and handed him over to us. But, the two sides resolved the issue amicably. We asked the accused to return the money,” said Solanki.

Title: Rare ‘Lajja Gauri’ idol discovered
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Mangaluru: A rare sixth century granite idol of ‘ Lajja Gauri ’ was discovered fixed beside the road at Barkur village in Udupi district.

Lajja Gauri is depicted nude and is said to be a fertility symbol. Dr Shivakant Bajpai, superintending archaeologist of ASI Bengaluru Circle, who is on a tour of the coastal districts, said he first came across the idol when its picture went viral on social media. He subsequently traced it to a public road in Barkur, which is an ancient historical town of coastal Karnataka. It was the ancient capital of the Alupa kingdom and a seat of power for several centuries.

“This is a very important idol and hundreds of vehicles pass by the idol every day, and could have damaged it. We are retrieving it, and I have issued an order to my local in-charge to keep it in safe custody. I have also sent a mail in this regard to the DC and SP of the district,” he said.

The idol is likely to be from the 6th or 7th centuries, though more research is required to confirm a date, Dr Bajpai added.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Health officials looking for a dozen people who had recently visited China
Content:
Representative image

DEHRADUN: Health officials of Pauri district are going door-to-door to locate people who, according to them, had recently visited China. Majority of these people live in Dehradun or Rishikesh and have paternal homes in Pauri. However, two of them had given incorrect phone numbers and incomplete address in their Local Intelligence Unit report, which is why, officials said it has become difficult for the health department to trace them. Pauri additional chief medical officer (ACMO), Dr Ramesh Kunwar told TOI that local police had alerted the health department that around 12 people from Pauri had recently visited China.“Our information was based upon the inputs from local intelligence unit. Though it was announced that people must come for initial screening, no one approached us in the last week. Now, we are going door-to-door to find out if they are affected with coronavirus or not,” said the ACMO.Till Friday, the Pauri health team had managed to scan four people in Rishikesh and one in Pauri.“We managed to track the addresses of six others as well. They had given the address of their ancestral houses in Pauri but some of them live in Dehradun and some in Kotdwar . Two people had mentioned that they are from Pauri. They didn’t furnish their correct house address and even phone numbers that they gave are not working,” said the ACMO, while claiming that all those who were screened had no symptoms of coronavirus and most of them were yoga teachers in China.

Title: After record highs, onion brings tears with new lows
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Photo for representative purpose only

BHOPAL: Weeks after the skyrocketing onion prices made the consumers cry, it’s the turn of onion farmers to shed tears of frustration, following a steep decline in its prices.

Rates of onion have been falling down with each passing day. In the onion growing district of Neemuch, it was sold at Rs 5 a kg to Rs 11 a kg on Friday while in Bhopal it was sold at Rs 5 to Rs 17 per kg in the wholesale market.

Interestingly, this is happening when the onion yield has just started arriving in the market; complete onion produce will arrive in the market by March. In the last three months or so, the onion prices wreaked havoc on consumers’ household budget when the cost of the commodity ranged between Rs 120 and 150 a kg in the state capital. The scenario wasn’t any different in the rest of the state.

Unseasonal rainfall in the onion growing belts of the country had damaged the crop, leading to its shortage and the price hike, lament wholesalers of Bhopal mandi. In states like Madhya Pradesh, onion crop arrives in February –March. It is really baffling that onion prices have started crashing as soon as the yield arrived in the mandis, said a market expert in Neemuch, Mustafa Hussain . “ At the moment about 1500 bags of onion, each weighing about 50 kg, are arriving in Neemuch mandi every day and rates vary from Rs 5 to Rs 11 a kg on Friday. Tonnes of onion will reach the mandis soon, and the prices are likely to go down further. If the trend continues, the farmers will have to start throwing away their produce, a practice seen in the past also,” said Hussain.

A big onion farmer of Neemuch, Mohan Nagda , lamented, “Unlike other products, farmers don’t fix the rates of their produce. We depend on the traders and they know the crop is bumper this year, hence taking advantage of this fact.” President of the wholesalers association of onion and potato in Bhopal ‘s Karond Mandi, Mohammad Idris, said, “ Prices of the best quality onion are falling by Rs 100 for 40 per kg every day for the past three days. It came down to Rs 700 per 40 kg on Friday from Rs 1000 per 40 kg on Wednesday.” Medium quality onion was available at a cost of Rs 20 per kg in Bhopal’s retail markets.

Member of the newly constituted Agriculture Development Council (ADC), Shivkumar Sharma alias kakka ji , said, “I had earlier recommended to former CM Shivraj Singh that the onion growing districts should be identified to develop a network of onion storage. I will raise this issue again in the next meeting of the council.”

Title: 3 arrested for auto theft, 3 bikes seized
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Allahabad: Three members of an inter-district gang of auto lifters were arrested on Frideay near Naini area while they were planning to resell stolen bikes. Three bikes were recovered.

The arrested auto lifters were identified as Bharat Prasad Pandey, Raj and Awadesh Tiwari alias Putali, all residents of Naini.

Naini inspector Awan Kumar told reporters, “We acted on a tip-of about the movement of three members of the gang who had allegedly stolen bikes from Chaka area on the intervening night of January 30 and 31. The police team cordoned Naini bypass road and nabbed them.”

“The trio were going to resell the bikes to Kydganj,” the inspector added.

Meanwhile, police have also arrested three persons—Raju Yadav of Lalapur, Narendra Tripathi of Ghurpur and Sanjay Yadav of Lalapur, all truck drivers—on charges of illegal mining and seized three sand-laden trucks. A case has been lodged in this connection.

Title: Congress unit gives out flyers on Savarkar
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Allahabad: Volunteers of Congress Sewa Dal on Friday distributed a 16-page booklet on Vinayak Damodar Savarkar, titled ‘Veer Savarkar Kitne Veer?’ at its camp in Magh Mela.

Earlier this month, Congress Seva Dal had stoked a controversy by releasing a booklet on Savarkar which questioned his credentials as a patriot. Congress leaders said the booklet was distributed to apprise people about lesser known facts regarding the right wing leader along with proof. UP Congress leader Mukund Tiwari said Sewa Dal volunteers distributed booklets on freedom fighters including Subhas Chandra Bose, Sardar Patel, Jawahar Lal Nehru and Bhagat Singh to tell people about the contribution of freedom fighters in freedom struggle.

“Be it freedom struggle or building of modern India, Sewa Dal played a major role. Congress Sewa Dal is the backbone of the party and it will continue to contribute in country’s development in future,” he said.

Title: Woman bludgeons man in road rage
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 22-year-old man from Ghatlodia on Thursday filed a complaint with police stating that a woman of about 30 slapped him and hit him on the head with a blunt object, in an incident of road rage on Wednesday evening.

In his FIR at Ghatlodia police station, Alkesh Desai, stated that he was riding pillion on his friend’s scooter when he was attacked.

“My friend Maulik Desai and I were travelling towards Sattadhar Crossroads from Ghatlodia. When I was crossing the road at Kalupur Bank, a car braked suddenly near our vehicle,” stated Alkesh in the FIR. He said that the car driver, a man of about 55, got out and began abusing him and Maulik.

“The driver began hitting us and his daughter got out of the car and began abusing us. She then slapped me, snatched my mobile and threw it on the road,” Alkesh stated. Passersby broke up the fracas and Alkesh then went to look for his mobile phone.

“When I was looking for my mobile, the woman had hit me on my head with a blunt object. I fell on to the road bleeding,” he states in the FIR.

Title: ASI suspended for dereliction of duty
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Mangaluru: Dakshina Kannada superintendent of police B M Laxmi Prasad said that a Kadaba police station assistant sub-inspector (ASI) will be suspended over dereliction of duty , as he failed to attend to an acid attack victim, when she called the station immediately after the incident.

The 35-year-old victim who is being treated at Wenlock Hospital, received serious burns after she was attacked by her brother-in-law with acid used in making rubber sheets, at Kodimbala, Kadaba taluk in Dakshina Kananda, on January 23. After her husband’s death, two years ago, she was fending for her family.

The decision was based on a report submitted by Puttur DySP Dinakar Shetty on the Kadaba acid attack case, where many people alleged that jurisdictional police had failed to act on the matter, and that the case was not dealt with properly. “In the report submitted, we have found that the ASI who was on duty on the day of the acid attack at Kadaba police station failed to respond to the victim’s call, when she called the station. Apart from it, the ASI did not intimate about the incident to his higher-ups, nor did he send any vehicle to help the victim. The victim came to the police station after the attack, to file a complaint. We have decided to suspend him for dereliction of duty,” superintendent of police B M Laxmi Prasad told TOI.

After allegations were made of mishandling the case, a committee was formed by SP Prasad. The committee submitted a report two days ago. There were allegations against police that they were shielding the accused, and that the investigation was not going in the right direction.

Senior police officials who did not want to be identified, said that the accused was sexually harassing the victim for a long time. Meanwhile, police, after recording the statement of the victim, have added additional cases against the accused. They are IPC sections 509 and 354a (sexual harassment).

“The victim was constantly requesting the police for help but it was denied. The spot mahajar at the victim’s house was not conducted as per procedure. Before the incident, the accused was sexually harassing the victim for a long time. All these observations have been stated in the report,” said a senior police official.

Title: Hundreds of Dalits in Bijnor ‘threaten’ conversion over procession
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Bijnor: Senior officials, including district magistrate (DM) of Bijnor, on Friday held a meeting with the representatives of two communities to iron out differences between them over taking out of a procession in Shyamiwala village to mark the Sant Ravidas Jayanti on Sunday. The procession was stopped by the district administration in 2013 after people of the minority community objected to it.

Now, people of the Dalit community have said that they will embrace Christianity if the procession is not allowed on the coming Sunday. A group of people, claiming to represent over 500 Dalits of Shyamiwala village, held the meeting with DM Ramakant Pandey.

“It was an age-old tradition, and we want it back,” said Omprakash Jonny, a member of the group which met the DM.

Omprakash told TOI, “We were carrying out the procession for the last many decades, it is not new. Samiwaala has close to 250 Dalit families with around 700 members. The objection was raised in 2013 during the SP government, prompting the district magistrate to stop the procession.”

Jonny claimed that they had filed a petition in Allahabad high court, in 2019, challenging the then DM’s order. The court had passed an order on March 3, 2019, asking the petitioners to approach the DM again, he said.

He further stated, “We have told the district magistrate that all Dalits in my village will convert to Christianity if we are prevented from taking out the procession, which is our fundamental right.”

When contacted, additional district magistrate Vinod Kumar Gaur said, “District magistrate had called both the groups on Friday at collectorate. We heard their arguments. The DM will take a call on it soon.”

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Account books lead police to killers of elderly couple, 4 held
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

According to the police, deceased Krishna Kumar Sharma was in money lending business which led to confrontatio... Read More

MEERUT: With arrest of four suspects, local police in UP’s Saharanpur district claimed to have solved the murder case of an elderly couple who were killed on February 5. According to the police, deceased Krishna Kumar Sharma (65) was in money lending business which led to confrontation between lender Krishna Kumar and the main accused who hails from his native village.

Krishna Kumar Sharma and his wife Sunita Sharma (56), who used to live alone at their Saharanpur residence in Shivpuri colony, were attacked by unidentified assailants on the morning of February 5. The accused had fled through the roof of the house after bolting the main door from inside. The couple with fatal injuries inflicted by axe was rushed to hospital where they were declared brought dead.

Police achieved their first breakthrough following careful study of account books, where deceased Krishna Kumar kept records of his money lending transactions, which were recovered from the crime scene. According to police, main accused Karan Singh had borrowed Rs 16-17 lakh from Krishna Kumar and the latter was insisting on payments. The accused then decided to bump off Krishna Kumar and hired two aides for the job.

“Based on the account books and CCTV footage in the area, we began our investigation. Later, we landed on more clues which helped us in zeroing in on the suspects who hail from deceased’s native place in Anantmau village. Karan, Johnny and Arun Saini are the main accused in the case,” Saharanpur SSP Dinesh Kumar P said.

“Karan had borrowed Rs 16-17 lakh from Krishna Kumar and the latter was insisting on payments. Karan hired Johnny and Arun Saini, also native of Anantmau village, for Rs 5 lakh for the double murder,” the Saharanpur SSP added.

According to police, after spotting familiar faces, deceased Krishna Kumar opened the door and the accused made friendly entry into the house on the day of incident. “The killers had hid their weapons, an axe and a fire arm, in their shawl. The accused caught Krishna Kumar off guard when he was busy scanning through the account book. The accused later attacked his wife Sunita who rushed to the spot after hearing screams for help,” the SSP also said.

Title: Mayor on dharna for inauguration of projects before he demits office
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Mayor Alok Sharma staged a dharna along with BJP corporators and party workers in front of Rani Kamlapati brid... Read More

BHOPAL: Mayor Alok Sharma staged a dharna on Friday, alleging that the Congress government is deliberately stalling inauguration of civic projects started durng his tenure.

Sharma, whose tenure as mayor ends in February, wants to inaugurate as many projects as possible before he demits office. But, according to him, the Congress government in the state is pushing back inauguration of projects that are ready or nearing completion.

On Friday, he staged a sit-in near the proposed arch bridge near Kamla Park, stating that it should have been completed a year ago, but is not being inaugurated because local Congress leaders want this to happen after he demits office.

“There are only three houses, which have to be shifted and work on the arch bridge would be completed. Former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan had agreed to shift encroachments so that the arch bridge, which would greatly ease the traffic on the road, could be completed on time, but after the Kamal Nath government came to power, the project has been stalled,” he alleged.

The mayor said he would inaugurate the statue of Rani Kamlapati and the bridge if the state government doesn’t announce the date of its inauguration by the time he demits office. The arch bridge has been named after the queen.

Sharma said the civic projects which were undertaken during his stint as mayor should be allowed to be inaugurated by him and the members of present municipal council, but the state government is not only putting those projects on hold, he is not even being invited to inauguration functions when they do take place.

“I am being ignored and insulted. This politics of ‘confrontation’ only disrupts development, but the Kamal Nath government seems to have decided to tread that path,” Sharma alleged.

BJP district president Vikas Virani , who also addressed the gathering, claimed that schemes undertaken by the former BJP government for the welfare of economically weaker sections, women, children and youth are being discontinued by the Kamal Nath government.

Title: Hill dists of U’khand receive snowfall, tourists rejoice
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Dehradun/Mussoorie: The higher reaches of Uttarakhand received snowfall on Friday causing cold-to-severe cold conditions across the state. The snow spell brought cheer for tourists in the state. Residents and tourists in Mussoorie were pleasantly surprised with the snowfall. This was the fifth snow spell of the season for the queen of hills.

The snowfall commenced in the afternoon at around 3 pm in Mussoorie and within a short time, the entire town was covered in a white blanket bringing cheer for the tourists.

“We never expected to witness snowfall. It is a pleasant surprise,” remarked Roshan, a tourist. The snowfall, which continued for nearly one-and-a-half hours caused issues for school children who were returning from their schools.

“No one expected a snowfall and hence we did not carry an umbrella in the morning. So we got drenched while walking back to our homes,” said Poonam, a local student.

The snow spell didn’t impede traffic and regular vehicular movements were reported between Mussoorie and Dehradun.

Mussoorie has been witnessing unusually cold conditions this season. Earlier spells of heavy snowfall had caused immense problems for the local residents.

Meanwhile, the meteorological department has said that the cold spell won’t last long as the state will see clear skies from Saturday. “We had predicted that minor snow spell in the hilly areas of Uttarakhand on February 7. However, the weather will get clear from February 8 and there won’t be any snowfall or rainfall in the state till February 13. The weather may again take a turn on February 14,” said Bikram Singh, director of the regional meteorological department.

The Met official added that the clear skies will be accompanied by a rise in mercury levels from February 8 to February 13.

Title: Eclipse over ambitious solar dome project again
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Vadodara: There seems to be no end to the delays in the ambitious solar dome project work of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC). The dome is coming up on the Akota-Dandiabazaar road.

Work stopped since January 27 after the bamboo scaffolding erected for work on the ceiling collapsed injuring one worker. After the incident, despite expectation of work to restart, nothing has moved so far.

The contractor has now shifted all the material for the work on the ceiling to the side of the road and applied hard breaks on the ongoing work. Sources said that the contractor wants complete closure of the road before resuming work.

The work on the ceiling of the dome was being conducted so far by closing the Akota to Dandiabazaar lane of the road under the dome. Traffic of both lanes used to merge on the Dandiabazaar to Akota lane on this portion under the dome.

“The contractor is concerned that in order to complete work in time, it will have to be done by closing the road completely,” said VMC executive engineer Paresh Patel from the futuristic planning cell. However, sources said that the recent accident had also contributed to the decision.

Patel said that they were trying to work out a solution so that the road remained open. “We are looking into the design of the scaffolding for this,” he said.

Title: Goa CM Parmod Sawant’s budget is hollow, unreal: Vijai Sardesai
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Vijai Sardesai

PANAJI: GFP chief Vijai Sardesai said that chief minister Parmod Sawant ’s maiden budget speech was filled with hollow announcements which lacked financial allocations.

GFP said that they did not expect the government to be able to adhere to the budget figures just as it failed to do for the current financial year.

“Only hollow announcement of priorities – resumption of mining, exploring hinterland, medical and eco-tourism, ease of living, ease of doing business, Goa as convention destination and educational hub- but no details of how these will be achieved,” said Sardesai.

He said that the budget did not explain how Sawant intended to restart mining operations, fund the recruitment of 1,200 policemen, purchase 50 electric buses for Kadamba and promote hinterland tourism.

“Where is the specific allocation? Where is tourism master plan?” Sardesai said. GFP also criticised the hike in excise rates, saying that domestic tourists coming to Goa will have no incentive to come to Goa for liquor.

“This budget has potential to kill tourism. Foreign tourists declining. And liquor, which is the main attraction for domestic tourists, will become more expensive because of considerable hikes in excise and licence fees,” Sardesai said.

Sardesai also said that the revenue surplus projected by Sawant was unrealistic. “How can a government that borrows money to pay old loans and interest have a revenue surplus?” asked the GFP MLA.

Title: Centre has murdered democracy in J&K: Azad
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Ajmer: Congress leader Gulam Nabi Azad here on Friday said the Centre has murdered democracy in Jammu and Kashmir (J&K).

He was speaking to reporters after offering prayers at Ajmer dargah.

Azad said, for the first time in history, people were put behind bars for the past seven months without any crime which is against democracy. “I raised the issue in Rajya Sabha about three former chief ministers and thousands of innocent people who were jailed without any charge. To restore peace in the Valley, all people must be released from jail.”

On Delhi polls, Azad said, BJP won’t come to power, however, he kept mum on performance of Congress.

Title: Crocs in Vishwamitri River, ponds to be counted today
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Cap

Vadodara: Barodians will soon know the exact number of crocodiles that they have been co-existing with.

The forest department will conduct census of crocodiles residing in Vishwamitri River and various ponds in and around the city on Saturday. The forest department conducted its last official crocodile census in 2015.

“We will be conducting the census in two parts. One in the morning and other in night. It will be done by forest officials and NGO volunteers,” said Nidhi Dave, regional forest officer (RFO), Vadodara. Eleven teams have been formed to conduct the census of which nine will focus on Vishwamitri River that is home to hundreds of crocodiles.

The census teams will visit the 17-km stretch of Vishwamitri River beginning from Vadodara-Ahmedabad Expressway to Talsat village in Makarpura. Count will also be done in ponds including Kashi Vishwanath Temple, Manjalpur, Kalali, Dena, Talsat, Chhani, Dumaad, Vemali, Harni, Sama, Vasna, Bhayli and Tandalja.

“Many of these ponds usually don’t have crocodiles, but it is possible that some reptiles may have shifted there during the floods last year,” a forest official said.

Forest officials are expecting that the count of crocodiles may go up this year as compared to 2015. During the floods that left many areas of the city submerged in monsoon, over 100 crocodiles that ventured out of Vishwamitri River and various ponds were rescued by the forest department. A large number of crocodiles in Vishwamitri River live in the stretch between Kala Ghoda and central jail.

Crocodiles in the river are very healthy as the adults on an average measure about 14 foot and weigh about 300 kg.

Title: Ram temple’s replica turns selfie point at Magh Mela
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

A man clicks a selfie near the replica of the proposed model for Ram temple at VHP’s camp on the Magh Mela gro... Read More

Allahabad: After the Union government announced the constitution of trust for construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya, replica of the proposed temple put on display at the camp of Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) in Magh Mela has become a major selfie point.

Devotees flocking at the ongoing Magh mela from neighbouring states like Madhya Pradesh and Bihar are visiting the camp to have a glimpse of the replica.

VHP office-bearers claimed that the number of devotees visiting the camp to see the replica of Ram temple has increased at least four-fold in last two days.

VHP spokesman Ashwani Mishra said: “For last two days, 8,000-10,000 devotees are visiting the camp per day to see the replica. At least eight lakh devotees have already visited the camp so far.”

He said the craze for replica had increased manifold since the Union government announced the trust for temple. VHP had unveiled the temple’s replica at its camp in sector 1 of Magh Mela area on January 12, decades after the structure was first put up on display during Kumbh Mela in 1989. This is the first time when VHP has displayed the model of Ram temple in Magh Mela. Earlier, it was displayed only during Kumbh and Ardh Kumbh.

“Visitors are interested in viewing the replica closely and offering prayers. We have also made elaborate arrangements as many pilgrims will visit the camp during the last 15 days of the Mela,” Mishra said. Shakuntala, who came to visit Magh Mela from Ayodhya, said; “I have visited Karsewakpuram many times to see the stones being carved for Ram temple but got the opportunity to have a glimpse of the replica at the ongoing Magh Mela.”

Usha Ghate of Gwalior said, “Everybody is keen to view the replica and hope that the model would be accepted by the trust”.

Title: Long wait over: JBS-MGBS Metro opens, phase 1 project on tracks
Content:
Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao takes a ride on JBS-MGBS Metro route after inaugurating the service on Frid... Read More

HYDERABAD: The Hyderabad Metro Rail Corridor-II (green corridor) between Jubilee Bus Station (JBS) and Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station (MGBS) was inaugurated by chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Friday.The launch of this 11-km long stretch has marked the completion of phase I of the Metro rail project. The total length of the Hyderabad Metro Rail is now 69 kilometres.The chief minister waved the green flag at JBS metro station, signalling the launch of the corridor and then took a ride from JBS to MGBS with MAUD minister KT Rama Rao, home minister Mohammad Mahmood Ali and other dignitaries.The JBS to MGBS metro train will have a total of nine stations - Secunderabad West, Gandhi Hospital, Musheerabad , RTC cross roads, Chikkadapally, Narayanguda, and Sultan Bazar.“We have utilized technologies like Communication Based Train Controls (CBTC), regenerative rolling stocks, etc. in building this project. Our endeavour is to provide world class metro rail services in Hyderabad,” said KVB Reddy, MD & CEO, L&T Metro Rail Hyderabad.While providing connectivity to the passengers of Secunderabad and Hyderabad, the service is also expected to reduce travel time from 45 minutes by road to just 16 minutes.“The inauguration of Corridor II will transform this city into a more modern and commuter-friendly one,” said SN Subrahmanyan, CEO & managing director, Larsen & Toubro.

Title: Women at anti-CAA stir in Deoband chant ‘Go Back’, throw bangles at locals persuading to call off protest
Content:
14-member delegation had met the protesters, but had to return empty-handed after agitating women raised sloga... Read More

MEERUT: A delegation of dignitaries formed by the local administration in Saharanpur district, to persuade the women protesting at Eidgah ground in Deoband in calling off their agitation, was left red-faced after it met with fierce opposition.Like Shaheen Bagh in Delhi, hundreds of women have been on indefinite sit-in at Eidgah ground in Deoband for the past 12 days in protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC). At the behest of local police and administration, members of local peace committee decided to meet the agitating women to persuade them in calling off the agitation.On Thursday, a 14-member delegation had met the protesters on Thursday but had to return empty-handed after agitating women raised slogans of “Go Back” and allegedly threw bangles at the delegation members. Police later claimed that anti-social element in the crowd instigated women forcing return of the delegation.“The delegation had gone to clear the air on NRC but some anti-social elements in the crowd instigated women who began sloganeering,” Saharanpur SSP Dinesh Kumar P said. “The main contention of the protesters was NRC and a clarification regarding government’s stand on it has already been put out in the Parliament. Now, economics is involved in the protest and people are making money,” he claimed.Amid the uproar, in a written reply to the Lok Sabha recently, Ministry of Home Affairs MoS Nityanand Rai had said that “till now, the government has not taken any decision to prepare NRC at the national level”.Meanwhile, a video of Darul Uloom vice-chancellor Abul Qasim Nomani making an appeal to hold conditional talks of peace committee members with women protesting in Deoband and persuade them in calling off the agitation went viral on social media. The video was later misrepresented to give an impression that Darul Uloom has made an appeal to call off agitation in Shaheen Bagh in Delhi.In an official press release, VC Nomani rubbished reports linking his comments with Shaheen Bagh protests. “The viral video of mine on social media is in fact a clip of meeting held by district administration regarding peace in Deoband wherein a false narrative was created that Darul Uloom appeals to end the protests. This is entirely baseless and false propaganda. My opinion is being wrongly twisted. It is clarified that Darul Uloom Deoband has not issued any appeal to end the country-wide protests. We pray that the struggle is crowned with success,” he said in the release.In Video: Deoband: Women at anti-CAA rally chant ‘go back’, throw bangles at dignitaries

Title: Oil leak from ONGC pipeline damages agricultural land, crops in Tiruvarur
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Trichy: Oil spill from the underground pipeline of ONGC carrying natural oil has damaged a fertile land cultivated with black gram crop in Tiruvarur district on Friday. Due to the oil leakage, a portion of the land is inundated with the crude oil.

Sources said that Panneerselvam hailing from Moolangudi village near Tiruvarur had cultivated black gram crop in his land. Beneath Panneerselvam’s cultivation field, ONGC had installed pipeline to carry the crude oil extracted from ONGC’s oil wells in Kamalapuram locality to one Early Production System (EPS) near Moolangudi, where the crude oil will be collected for further processing.

Meanwhile, on Friday, a leakage in the underground oil pipeline was reported in Panneerselvam’s field as crude oil leaking appeared on the surface of the land. The aggrieved farmer, who had lost his crop, maintained that the revival process will take years to restore his field damaged due to the oil spill, has sought for compensation.

The ONGC Cauvery asset officials were subsequently alerted about the oil spill. “A team of officials inspected the field and immediately plugged the oil leakage. Appropriate compensation will be provided to the farmer for the oil spill,” an official source with ONGC said. ONGC Cauvery asset managing the natural oil and gas exploration in Cauvery delta districts including Tiruvarur said that a study will be done in the pipeline running below the Moolangudi village in Tiruvarur district to prevent such incidents in future.

Title: City to host national U-18 tennis tourney
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Trichy: The Trichy District Tennis Association (TDTA) will host the under-18 national level tennis tournament for boys and girls in the city from February 10. As many as 112 players including 64 boys recognised by the All India Tennis Association (AITA) are expected to participate in the event.

The AITA National Series Tennis Tournament jointly organised by TDTA and Kauvery hospital will be held at the Union Club and Officers Club from February 10. Organisers said that top-seeded AITA players will directly participate in the tournament. Low-ranked AITA players (based on the AITA points) will have to win the qualifiers on Saturday and Sunday.

Players winning the qualifiers will proceed to the main games. “Players from Gujarat, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra will participate in the tournament to be held in knockout format. All the games shall be hosted on clay courts,” said J Narasimhan, tournament secretary. tnn

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Key post for preventing contagions lying vacant
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: The state government is yet to appoint the full-time joint director of health services for prevention and containment of epidemic-prone diseases, considering the threat of novel coronavirus infection.For now, an officer of family welfare department has been given an additional charge of this post.“The office of the joint director of health services monitors epidemic control programme in Maharashtra. However, this crucial post has been lying vacant since January 1, 2020. An officer who is already overburdened in training medical officials in state’s family welfare programme has been given an additional charge of such an important post,” medical practitioner and activist Abhijit More said.He said the joint director, who is the technical head of the state, was responsible for surveillance of epidemic diseases, control of epidemic and reduction in such cases and casualties. “In the prevailing situation, when the threat of the novel coronavirus is looming large, how can the state government keep such an important post vacant? It should be filled on an urgent basis,” More said.A senior health official said purchasing N95 masks and other protection equipment and kits were not enough to overcome challenges posed by outbreaks like the one in China. “Filling up the key vacant posts and also posts of ground staff are the key to prevent and contain spread of viruses and communicable diseases,” he said.Another official said there was absolute lack of understanding at the highest level of policymakers and health authorities. “What they are interested in is patchy work. There is no long-term plan, vision and preparedness. Once the prevailing scare is over, things will be back to as they were,” he said.“If we look at what is happening in China. Similar situation in Pune will require 1,000 ICU beds in government’s public health sector alone. A key post of a joint director can mobilise resources and bring in coordination between various government heath agencies in providing critical care in emergency situation. Currently, there is no one to take such calls,” said another health official.When contacted, public health expert Archana Patil, director of the state health department said, “We have already initiated the process of filling the post of the joint director (epidemic prone diseases) at state health department.”

Title: Maharashtra: Cool start to weekend after wind brings down minimum temperature to 10.1°C
Content:
Pune was the third coolest place in the state on Friday after Mahabaleshwar's 9.9 degrees celsius and Nashik's... Read More

PUNE: The weather threw up a surprise again on on Friday morning after the mercury plunged to 10.1°C in Shivajinagar and 10.7 °C in Pashan, but Saturday is likely to be cooler at 9C.The northerly winds were felt at noon and early evening in the city on Friday as the air had a distinct chill to it.All weather parameters are pointing to this plunge in night temperature which could continue till Saturday, especially in Konkan and Madhya Maharashtra.Pune was the third coolest place in the state on Friday after Mahabaleshwar's 9.9 degrees celsius and Nashik's 10 degrees celsius. The city's temperature has dipped for the fourth time in 69 days of winter.On January 1, Shivajinagar recorded 10.1 degrees celsius, then 8.2 degrees celsius on January 17, 9.6 degrees celsius on January 18 and on Friday when the mercury showed 10.1 degrees celsius.Pune and parts of Maharashtra, especially north Madhya Maharashtra and north Konkan finally experienced winter-like minimum temperatures on Friday morning. Night temperatures were 1-3 degrees below the normal on Friday in these places.Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather, IMD, Pune told TOI that there is a big chance that the minimum temperature could fall below 10 degrees C in Pune on Saturday.Not only Pune, but isolated places in northern Madhya Maharashtra may record a 2-3 degrees C below normal minimum temperatures on Saturday, but IMD has ruled out any chance of cold wave conditions, he said.“ This is one of the very few periods this winter when we are seeing the cold, dry northerly wind flow reaching Madhya Maharashtra and Konkan, the two regions which have especially reported above normal night temperatures this season,” Kashyapi added.The wind pattern over Konkan and Madhya Maharashtra on Friday was northerly—from the lower atmospheric level and marginally above, he added.“We did not see this effect in north Marathwada and Vidarbha. The northerly winds covered almost 4/5th area of Konkan and Madhya Maharashtra, which led to a drop in minimums in many stations in these regions. However, from Sunday, we expect the minimum temperature to start rising gradually as the wind pattern may change gradually to easterly to south easterly winds,” he said.Southeasterly and easterly winds blow from the Bay of Bengal and are moist and relatively warmer— being the opposite of northerly winds, which come from the snow-capped hilly regions of north India carrying the chill.In the wake of the chill on Friday, day temperatures plunged too, with many stations recording temperatures below 30 degrees celsius.

Title: Five years after announcement, expansion of Pantnagar airport lies pending
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

Pantnagar airport director, SK Singh, said that the previous plans were shelved due to technical glitches

RUDRAPUR: Announced in 2015, the expansion of the only airport in Kumaon region at Pantnagar in Udham Singh Nagar district still lies pending. This is despite a local complaining against the delay with the ministry of civil aviation last year.

In his letter dated July 16, 2019, addressed to Hardeep Singh Puri, minister of state (MoS) for civil aviation, the complainant Bhagwan Das had said that the expansion of Pantnagar airport was announced in 2015 and banners of the same were put up at Pantnagar airport. These banners had Prime Minister's face on it. Das also mentioned the record of actions in previous years in the letter.

The letter shot by Das reads, "The current airport was to be expanded on contiguous land. However, the plan was shelved because of various limitations like an elephant corridor, railway property, and other restrictions. Later, a new site adjacent to the current airport was considered but after three years of deliberations, this site was shelved due to unknown reasons".

Das further stated that the original site was again considered upon. "Consequently, after four years of back and forth, we came back to square one," the letter added. He requested the ministry to intervene and also sent the copies of complaint to Uttarakhand ’s chief minister and chief secretary, who on July 26, 2019, directed the competent authorities of civil aviation to take prompt actions.

Talking to TOI, Pantnagar airport director, SK Singh, said that the previous plans were shelved due to technical glitches. "We have now identified almost 1,100 acres of land near Pantnagar industrial area stretching towards Kichha town. But the land has not been transferred to the airport authority. Once the district administration hands over the land, the expansion will be done swiftly,” Singh said.

Meanwhile, Udham Singh Nagar district magistrate Neeraj Kharwal said that the process for selecting the land for the expansion of airport is still ongoing. "As soon as we find a land catering to all the requirements of an airport, the acquisition and transfer will be initiated at the earliest,” he said.

Title: Former UPPSC exam controller gets bail in LT Grade paper leak
Content:
This story is from February 8, 2020

A file photograph of Anju Katiyar during her arrest

Allahabad: Allahabad high court on Friday granted bail to former examination controller of UP Public Service Commission ( UPPSC ), Anju Katiyar, who was lodged in jail for her involvement in the LT Grade Teacher Examination-2018 paper leak case.

While directing for the release of Katiyar on bail, Justice Ramesh Sinha said the trial should be expedited and preferably conclude within a year, provided there are no legal impediments.

The court also directed that Katiyar would have to surrender her passport, if any, before the trial court. She has also been directed to submit an undertaking that she won’t leave the country without obtaining permission from this court or till the trial concludes.

On May 30, 2019, the Special Task Force had arrested Katiyar for her alleged involvement in leaking the question papers of two subjects for LT Grade Teacher Exam-2018 in Varanasi. She was sent to jail after being produced before the court.

The former UPPSC examination controller was arrested after several rounds of questioning. The STF also scanned her laptop and went through her documents. The team also managed to collect evidence from her office and residence.
